intro: Cyrtandra campaniformis, commonly known as the bell-shaped Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, fleshy leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
